title: Romantic Valentine single-page prompt with evasive No button and Yes meme reveal

requirements.text: Create a single-page, romantic-themed Valentine prompt UI that asks: "Will you be my Valentine?" with two prominent options: "Yes" and "No".

quotes:
Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend... ask her to be my Valentine.

There should be two options: Yes or No.

acceptanceCriteria: The page shows a clear main question: "Will you be my Valentine?"
All user-facing text is in English

requirements.text: Implement interactive behavior for the "No" option so it moves away when the user attempts to interact with it (hover on desktop; pointer/touch interaction on iPad) such that it cannot be clicked.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, when the cursor approaches/enters the "No" button area, the button relocates to a new position within the visible container
On iPad/touch, attempting to tap/press the "No" button causes it to move before a click/tap can be registered
The "No" button always remains fully visible within the main content area (does not move off-screen)
It is not possible to successfully click/tap the "No" button in normal use

requirements.text: When the user clicks "Yes", replace the prompt UI with a celebratory view that displays a meme image containing the text: "Good choice".

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her "Good choice

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping "Yes" transitions to a success state
The success state prominently displays the generated meme image with readable text "Good choice"
The original "Yes"/"No" prompt is no longer the primary focus after clicking "Yes" (e.g., hidden or replaced)

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive romantic visual theme using a pink and white color scheme, including typography and decorative styling that feels romantic while keeping the page simple and focused on the single Valentine prompt purpose.

quotes: The page should be simple, romantic-themed...
The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme

acceptanceCriteria: The primary palette is pink and white, with appropriate contrast for readability
Layout remains intentionally simple with one clear call-to-action
Styling is consistent across the prompt and the "Yes" success view

requirements.text: Add the required generated image(s) to the frontend as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them directly from the frontend (do not serve images from the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated image files exist under frontend/public/assets/generated
The success view loads the meme image via a static path from the frontend
No backend endpoints are used for image delivery

requirements.text: Ensure the page works well on iPad Chrome, including responsive layout, large tap targets, and interaction logic that does not rely solely on mouse hover.

quotes: ...so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: Buttons are sized for touch (comfortable tap targets) and remain usable on tablet-sized screens
The "No" evasion behavior works on touch interaction (not just hover)
No horizontal scrolling is required on iPad-sized viewports

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI components must be composed, not edited).

Do not modify files listed as immutable: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, and frontend/src/components/ui.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; however, this feature should be implemented without requiring backend changes.
nonGoals: Persisting any user state on the backend
Adding additional pages or features beyond the Valentine prompt and the Yes success reveal

required: Square meme-style image with the text "Good choice" in a romantic pink/white aesthetic (good-choice-meme.dim_800x800.png)
